Package model

Class Game

java.lang.Object
model.Game
public class Game extends Object
Authors: Bryan Bielawa, Carissa Burnham, Cooper Harris, Drew Marien This class is used to facilitate all interactions between Board.java and BoardGUI.java. This class also plays sound for when the gui takes certain actions. All sound is directed through a media player

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Game(int size)
    Generates an empty board of the given size This constructor is used to initalize the toolkit for the sound to play.
    Game(int size, int difficulty)
    This will generate a board of a given size with a spread of randomly generated values.

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(int size, int difficulty)
      This will generate a board of a given size with a spread of randomly generated values.
      Parameters:
      size - is the size of the board, please use either 4,6, or 9
      difficulty - is the difficulty, 3=easy, 2=medium, 1=hard

    • Game

      public Game(int size)
      Generates an empty board of the given size This constructor is used to initalize the toolkit for the sound to play. DO NOT TOUCH THIS
      Parameters:
      int - size of board

  • Method Details

    • newGame

      public void newGame(int newSize, int newDifficulty)
      This will reset the game and create a new board
      Parameters:
      newSize - is the new size of the board, use 4, 6, or 9
      newDifficulty - is the difficulty, 3=easy, 2=medium, 1=hard

    • playNewGameSound

      public void playNewGameSound()
      This will play the level_up.mp3 sound. This should be used to play a sound after an action.

    • printState

      public void printState()
      This will print the board into the console. Pencil mark values will have a * in front of the value This will also print the board size and difficulty.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      This function will return the width of the board as an int value. The width/size value of the board is set when a new board is created.
      Returns:
      int value of board size.

    • getCellValue

      public int getCellValue(int row, int col)
      This will return an int value for the value of the specified coordinate value on the board. Board range is 0 to size-1
      Parameters:
      row - int of the board value
      col - int of the board value
      Returns:
      int value of board position

    • makeMove

      public void makeMove(int row, int col, int value, boolean isSound)
      This will change a value of the specified coordinate on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - int of the board position to change
      col - int of the board position to change
      value - is the new int value for the board positon
      isSound - a toggle to play the select_sound.mp3

    • togglePencilMark

      public void togglePencilMark(int row, int col)
      This will toggle the pencil mark value of a specified coordinate on the board. If the value is true, it switches to false and if it is true it turns false.
      Parameters:
      row - int of the board position to change
      col - int of the board position to change

    • isCellPencilMark

      public boolean isCellPencilMark(int row, int col)
      This will return the boolean pencil mark value of a specified coordinate on the board.
      Parameters:
      row - int of the board position
      col - int of the board position
      Returns:
      boolean pencilmark value of board cell

    • isWon

      public boolean isWon()
      This will run the isBoardComplete() function from Board class. This is a complex function that searches for any error within the sudoku board. If any error or empty coordinate value is found this will return false, if not then true. This will also play a victory sound.
      Returns:
      boolean value for board completion

    • getErrorsStr

      public String getErrorsStr()
      If any errors are present on the board, this function will find it. This should only be run when the function complete.
      Returns:
      A string containing coordinate x,y values for coordinate on the board that violate the rules of sudoku.

    • getErrorsArray

      public ArrayList<Integer> getErrorsArray()
      If any errors are present on the board, this function will find it. This should only be run when the function complete.
      Returns:
      ArrayList containing coordinate x,y values for coordinate on the board that violate the rules of sudoku.
